title: [Large-Scale] Project-Based Learning Strategies for Developing Scientific Inquiry and Critical Thinking Skills in Online Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental theories and research methodologies in science, basic knowledge of experimental design and data analysis (variable control, measurement tool utilization), and experience with online collaboration tools
context.additional_context: Strengthening real-time online collaboration and social interaction for current science professionals, developing critical thinking through the scientific inquiry process (observation-hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion). Emphasizes experimental reproducibility and rigor in data interpretation.

learning_goals: Learners design and execute an online PBL project applying the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formulation, independent/dependent variable control, experimental design) to solve real-world scientific problems

Learners can collaborate with two peers to solve three science problems using socially shared metacognitive scaffolding strategies (e.g., role division, feedback routines), producing a report that meets at least four of five critical thinking checklist items based on evidence-based analysis (referencing â‰¥2 experimental datasets) and logical reasoning (applying deductive/inductive methods).
Learners evaluate and present project outcomes and improvement strategies based on quantitative data measurements and statistical analyses, following a structured feedback format.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
